title: City Girls’ JT Out of Prison, Ready to Act Up With a New Single
text:
JT Photo: Jeff Hahne/Getty Images

The true scammers of our time, City Girls, are back after far too long. The duo was on the rise last year after grabbing a feature on Drake’s “In My Feelings” before JT (née Jatavia Johnson) turned herself in on a credit-card-fraud charge. That didn’t stop the group — they released their second album, the Cardi B–cosigned Girl Code, while JT was behind bars; if the single “Act Up” sounds familiar, it’s because it’s sampled in “Hot Girl Summer.” But Yung Miami (née Caresha Brownlee) announced today on Instagram that her partner is out of prison, and they’re celebrating tonight with a fittingly titled new release, “First Day Out.” “YOU BITCHES IN TROUBLE!! MY BITCH HOME!” Yung Miami warns in the caption. In her own post, JT writes, “You Bitches Could Neva.” And we trust them!
description: Half of the rising rap duo City Girls, JT, turned herself in on a credit-card-fraud charge last year. She and her partner, Yung Miami, teased the group’s comeback song “First Day Out.”
